image.altText: A graphic illustration of a Toyota, showing the DPF filter in the engine.

props.synopsis: The action was brought by thousands of people who bought faulty Toyota and Ford cars between 2015-2020.

title.children: High Court to allow appeal from Toyota and Ford owners in compensation case over faulty vehicles

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Lisa Wilkinson unsuccessfully argued against delaying the case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against defamation case findings delayed

image.altText: Two men holding booklets entitled "The Integrated Energy Plan'' stand in front of  a back drop with "ACT Government'' logos.

props.synopsis: The Greens confirm they will not join a Labor-led government as the ACT Legislative Assembly sits for the first time since the territory election, appointing Andrew Barr as chief minister and Mark Parton as speaker.

title.children: ACT Greens say they will not form coalition with Labor following failed negotiations over 'big issues'

image.altText: USA Votes live stream image

props.synopsis: Follow live as the US decides if Donald Trump or Kamala Harris will win the presidency.

title.children: Watch the ABC News live coverage of the US election

image.altText: Queensland police GPS tracker on an ankle worn by a person on a Brisbane city street.

props.synopsis: The federal government loses a crucial High Court battle over a law requiring former immigration detainees to be monitored by ankle bracelets and live under a curfew.

title.children: Government loses High Court case on legality of curfew and ankle bracelets

image.altText: The exterior of a building with a sign that reads "Lyneham High School".

props.synopsis: According to an email sent to parents and carers the school went into a precautionary lockdown after some students came onto school grounds in a "heightened" state and using threatening behaviour.

title.children: Canberra school hires security guard, locks some entrances after students use 'threatening' behaviour

image.altText: A girl looks towards the camera while sitting on her father's lap.

props.synopsis: It took 10-year-old Ashley Clifford's parents a decade of bouncing from specialist to specialist for their daughter to be diagnosed with Beck-Fahrner syndrome, and they're confident more families are in the same limbo they once were.

title.children: 10-year-old Ashley is one of only 30 people in the world known to have Beck-Fahrner syndrome

image.altText: A man in a black shirt and a women in a white shirt holding two gold hand statues.

props.synopsis: Police found the hand statues, along with other allegedly stolen items including a pump action rifle, while searching a 39-year-old man's home in north Canberra.

title.children: Tony was 'devastated' when two gold hands were stolen from his son's grave. Now, they have been returned

image.altText: Army troops walk in grass

props.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, in his nightly video address, thanked those in the world who, he said, had reacted to the dispatch of North Korean troops to Russia last month "not just with words … but who are preparing actions to support our defence".

title.children: First clash between Ukrainian and North Korean troops reported

image.altText: a woman in black walks up steps

props.synopsis: Parents sobbed, embraced and covered their faces with their hands as photos of blood stains on the jumping castle at the centre of a tragedy that killed six children in 2021 were shown to a Tasmanian court.

title.children: Parents grief overflows as photos of jumping castle shown in Hillcrest tragedy criminal case

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock warns Treasurer Jim Chalmers to remain "fully aware" of the inflationary consequences of the federal government's spending promises as it heads into a federal election.

title.children: 'He needs to be thinking about that': RBA governor gives blunt spending warning to treasurer

image.altText: The sun rises into a smoky sky above a city.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is warning vast parts of the east of the country will experience above-average temperatures, raising fire risks from today.

title.children: Bureau warns of 'shock to the system' as parts of country to feel their first taste of high summer temperatures

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a dark blazer answers questions from a reporter in a corridor.

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor has downplayed concerns about his colleague's disclosures as the flight upgrade saga continues. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition downplays concerns over reports Bridget McKenzie didn't declare flight upgrades

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 📹 'A moment of profound consequence': Anthony Albanese on the US election
Make a complaint if you have one, Watt tells construction workers
Coalition brands government's High Court loss 'embarrassing'

image.altText: The States To Watch: Oval Office building next to man in shirt next to title text.

props.synopsis: Casey Briggs walks you through what to watch as the votes come in, with some states carrying more weight in deciding who will win the election.

title.children: The quick guide on which states to watch in the US election

image.altText: Kim Williams at a press conference in Canberra

props.synopsis: ABC chair Kim Williams says investment and regulation are needed to fund the production of Australian stories, as he calls for the broadcaster to be "aggressively, consciously ambitious" in its programming.

title.children: 'Australian content has never mattered more': ABC chair says more funding is needed to tell our stories

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Officials from the Treasury, ATO and ACCC will face senate estimates today. Meanwhile, investors brace for volatile trading this week as voting begins in an extremely tight US presidential election. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Treasury officials face senate estimates hearing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How will climate change impact future insurance premiums?
Why the Aussie dollar is falling heavily today
Bitcoin hits record high of $US74,000 (and keeps climbing)

image.altText: Dark smoke over a rural town.

props.synopsis: A Leave Immediately warning was issued for Dirranbandi around 8pm, with that warning downgraded to Watch and Act — Not Safe to Return just before 10pm last night.

title.children: Residents of south-west Queensland town evacuated due to bushfire, with 40 degree day forecast

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles beside a black horse.

props.synopsis: When Knight's Choice was born in northern New South Wales five years ago, 76-year-old breeder Norm Bazeley never dreamed he would become a stayer in the race that stops the nation.

title.children: As the foal of a $1,000 mare, Knight's Choice was never meant to win the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Close-up of shark with wide, flat head with its mouth open and shark teeth exposed

props.synopsis: Is your shark knowledge a bit … fishy? Let's find out how well you know these impressive ocean predators.

title.children: Shark quiz: How much do you know about great whites and megalodons?

image.altText: An older man sits at a table looking at a letter.

props.synopsis: A pair of boarding houses in the heart of Sydney are being redeveloped into luxury homes. But elderly residents who have lived there for decades fear they have nowhere to go.

title.children: Pensioner Sav is being evicted, and it's highly likely he won't find new housing in the neighbourhood he has called home for 56 years

image.altText: A person in a jacket expressing support for the CFMEU.

props.synopsis: Several workers in the construction sector say they will not speak to the CFMEU administrator about their experiences with the union because insufficient legal protections mean they fear retribution.

title.children: Construction insiders fear speaking out against CFMEU without whistleblower protections

image.altText: GettyImages-2181540574

props.synopsis: The AFLW grand final will be played at night, despite the league having to wait until the preliminary finals are over to know where the game will be played.

title.children: League confirms AFLW grand final will be played at night with venues in several states locked in

image.altText: Ruben Amorim gestures at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Rúben Amorim does not officially start his job as Manchester United manager until early next week but his first clash with British media has already captured global attention.

title.children: British journalist accused of 'entitlement' after insisting Portuguese manager speak English

image.altText: AJ Brimson of the Titans looks skyward and is tried during an NRL match

props.synopsis: Gold Coast have referred AJ Brimson to the NRL Integrity Unit for a social media post on Melbourne Cup day.

title.children: AJ Brimson referred to NRL Integrity Unit over Melbourne Cup bet post

image.altText: A red N logo.

props.synopsis: Investigators specialising in financial crime and corruption searched the US streaming giant's offices in Paris and Amsterdam on Tuesday.

title.children: Netflix under tax fraud investigation with offices raided in France and the Netherlands

image.altText: The Israeli PM sitting next to his defence minister at a function.

props.synopsis: Mr Netanyahu announced the decision in a video statement, saying "full trust is required between the prime minister and the minister of defence".

title.children: Netanyahu sacks defence minister Gallant over 'crisis of trust' on Israel's wars in Gaza and Lebanon

image.altText: A woman looking at a student wearing VR glasses.

props.synopsis: For the first time last year students across Victoria were asked a simple but complicated question, have you experienced racism?

title.children: Only Victoria and NSW ask students about racism at school

image.altText: Gout Gout in action for Australia

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's manager James Templeton reveals the teenage sensation is likely to skip the 2026 Commonwealth Games, is planning for a US training camp with Olympic champion Noah Lyles, and explains why comparisons to Usain Bolt are being avoided at all costs.

title.children: Gout Gout's manager on training with Noah Lyles, skipping the Comm Games and comparisons to 'UB'

image.altText: The East Perth power station lit up at night in a golden hue.

props.synopsis: lt's stood abandoned on the banks of the Swan River for more than 40 years — now the Perth Festival is transforming the East Perth power station into an entertainment and arts precinct for three weeks every summer.

title.children: Once valued at only $1, the old East Perth power station will finally be put to good use

image.altText: A man sands beside a sea plane inside his home.

props.synopsis: At the edge of the Pacific Ocean in North Queensland a community of aircraft enthusiasts are building their homes and lives metres from a commercial airfield. They say it is the best decision they have ever made.

title.children: Residential airparks take off as pilots combine love of flying with island lifestyle

image.altText: Image of oysters from Coles Bay Tasmania on a plate with a lemon slice.

props.synopsis: Aquaculturalists fear a desalination plant that could be built near WA's largest hatchery would have a substantial impact on oyster production and the surrounding environment.

title.children: Fears desalination plant could damage one of Australia's premier oyster harbours

image.altText: The sun shines through the large windows of a classroom onto two girls in a classroom doing work at their desks.

props.synopsis: There are calls for government action to mandate indoor air quality standards and improve "terrible" ventilation in Australian schools that can hamper student learning.

title.children: Tests show classroom CO2 levels far exceed guidelines, putting children's learning at risk

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie leaning on a jetty rail.

props.synopsis: Uncle Ken's ancestors told stories of the land trembling and the ocean moving. Researchers believe this information is crucial for advancing scientific understanding of major events and changes to Australia's environment over time.

title.children: Aboriginal stories give insight into significant events in Australia's natural history
